zh: 学而不思则罔，思而不学则殆。
en: Learning without thought is labour lost; thought without learning is perilous.
Among any three people walking, I will find something to learn for sure.

zh: 知之为知之，不知为不知，是知也。
en: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.

zh: 工欲善其事，必先利其器。
en: A craftsman who wishes to do his work well must first sharpen his tools.

zh: 在你不能衡量它之前，你无法改进它。
en: If you can't measure it, you can't improve it.

zh: 简洁是智慧的灵魂，冗长是肤浅的藻饰。
en: Brevity is the soul of wit.

zh: 我之所以看得更远，是因为站在巨人的肩膀上。
en: If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

zh: 知之者不如好之者，好之者不如乐之者。
en: One who knows is not equal to one who loves; one who loves is not equal to one who delights in it.

zh: Stay hungry, stay foolish.（求知若饥，虚心若愚）
预测未来的最好方法就是创造它。
en: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

zh: 音乐是比一切智慧、一切哲学更高的启示。
en: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
